Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hit a breathtaking knock and overshadowed senior pros Kohli and Sharma.
Virat Kohli played the role of an anchor to perfection and also ended as the game's top-scorer.
KL Rahul's second successive failure stuck out like a sore thumb.
Rohit initially struggled with his timing but found some rhythm going his way, as the fifty came off 35 balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The relative slowness of the track post the Bangladesh-South Africa game effected the Netherlands' approach.
India were 67 for one at the halfway stage, but after Surya came in, the Dutch bowling unit looked intimidated, and once Kohli started putting pressure there was no escape.
Others: India thrashed Netherlands by 56 runs for its second win in the T20 World Cup.
The Indian batting save all but one fired in unison as skipper Rohit became the pace setter.

The Netherlands was the fourth team to bat on the track, and although there wasn't any considerable wear and tear, it slowed down enough for Axar Patel and Ravichandran Ashwin to tighten the noose on the opposition batters.
